turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about French landscape garden.
turn.1: What were the important elements in the design of the French landscape garden?
turn.2: A later influence was the gardens of Horace Walpole at Strawberry Hill (beginning 1750), where Gothic ruins replaced antique temples.
turn.4: Later, the gardens of Capability Brown, who had studied with William Kent, had an important influence in France, particularly his work at Stowe (1748), Petworth (1752), Chatsworth (1761), Bowood (1763) and Blenheim Palace (1769).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Descriptions of English gardens were first brought to France by the Abbé Le Blanc, who published accounts of his voyage in 1745 and 1751.
turn.7: What other things did he do?
turn.8: A treatise on the English garden, "Observations on Modern Gardening", written by Thomas Whately and published in London in 1770, was translated into French in 1771.
turn.9: Did they have any other influences?
turn.10: After the end of the Seven Years' War in 1763, French noblemen were able to voyage to England and see the gardens for themselves.
turn.12: During the French Revolution, many French nobles went into exile in England, and brought back with them the new style of gardening.
